result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Phone call from Atty D'Angelo and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the PTC that was set on 10/13/2022 at 9am to 12/15/2022 at 9am. This was rescheduled because the defendant has open cases in other counties and this would allow the other cases to resolve first.
I informed Atty D'Angelo that he has a speedy trial demand on file and Atty D'Angelo agreed to go beyond the time limits.
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty D'Angelo in the office and Jordan/DA's office by phone rescheduled the PTC that was set on 9/23/2022 at 11am to 10/13/2022 at 9am. Jordan will prepare Writ.
Email correspondence w/ counsel regarding 9/23/2022 hrg/defendant incarcerated at DCI

1:59 PM Court calls 21CF243, 22CF111 Defendant Nathan R. Neldner in court, in custody.  Attorney John P. D'Angelo in court for Nathan R. Neldner. 22CF11 - Information reviewed/waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY Plea.  Court appoints Atty. D'Angelo as dean on 221CF111 and he is to file paperwork accordingly.  Defense argues Bond Motion to allow him to attend rehab at the Jackie Nitschke Center.  Court denies motion.  Present bond cont'd.  Both cases scheduled for PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bond
from Deft. re: release for treatment/Response from Judge Judge 6/27/22

3:07 PM Defendant Nathan R. Neldner in court, in custody.  Attorney John P. D'Angelo in court for Nathan R. Neldner. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Rachael Race/VWC in court. PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Court finds the defendant's waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant is bound over to circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at next hearing. Atty D'Angelo addresses court on modification of bond. Court does not address due to the cases being Judge Judge's and request a formal motion to be filed w/ the court. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:13 AM Defendant Nathan R. Neldner in court, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty D'Angelo appears with deft.  Complaint reviewed.  Court to Dean appoint to this case as well.  PH within time limits.

Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

additional/new $25,000 cash on this case. Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ co-defendants Roy Boucher and Joseph Desotell. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

12:02 PM Defendant Nathan R. Neldner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD Atty Spansail appearing from OC Jail for today's hrg. Defendant understands charges/advised of right to counsel/SPD info given. State request cash bond in case #21CF243 be revoked. Court will advise RCO of state's request to revoke bond and hold bond until Judge Judge rules. Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
